google_reviews.author: Cedric Johnson
google_reviews.review: I recently secured an apartment with Landmark after not having moved in several years. The website is user-friendly, making it easy to view available listings, schedule a showing, and submit my application online. All staff members I interacted with were friendly, helpful, and responsive via text, phone, and when I viewed the unit in person. All important building policies and costs were clearly laid out in writing and the staff I spoke with made sure to highlight and confirm important details. The entire process was smooth.

google_reviews.author: Jeff Schrader
google_reviews.review: I have recently moved into a.unit at the Maritime Heritage Apartments, which Landmark manages. Not having moved in a long time I was unsure what to expect, but the entire process was pretty smooth. The unit is as good as advertised. Applying was straightforward enough, and the company responded quickly to any questions I had. I was surprised at the number of documents that I had to sign, but I realize this is all part of the procedures for moving. I'll see how things progress from here, but so far Landmark has been good in the apartment they had and the support needed.

google_reviews.author: Taya Sushch
google_reviews.review: We had such an amazing experience finding our home to rent at Landmark Real Estate Management. Cami and Yanna were very helpful, efficient and did such a wonderful job explaining everything to us and helping us through our application process. They were also very good with following up. And understanding when my situation changed and we ended staying longer. They helped us renew our lease the second time. Stress free!! Everything was easy and smooth and that is more than you can ask for in such a stressful moving time. Every time we need anything fixed, it was always done in a timely manner and with good quality. I feel comfortable calling and speaking to them about any questions I have? Thank you so much to the team at Landmark Real Estate Management!!

google_reviews.author: John K. Cummings
google_reviews.review: Landmark is very professional and courteous property Management group. I really enjoyed the two years that I lived in their apartment. I got to know Marianna well and appreciate everything she did for me. I highly recommend if you're a renter using landmark property management group.

google_reviews.author: Mindy Kampen
google_reviews.review: I moved into the Maritime Heritage Apartment Complex and I love it here!  Cami and everyone at Landmark did such a wonderful job helping me and made my move easy and enjoyable!  Hailey the property manager at the complex is always on site and does a great job of taking care of everything at the building complex.  It is such a nice and upscale place to live   Landmark is exceptional in my book! Highly recommend!

google_reviews.author: Drew Secules
google_reviews.review:
Updated: If you choose to be a customer of Landmark, make sure you know your rights and how to advocate for yourself. I am typically pretty easy going, and I love to avoid conflicts when I can. I am slow to escalate situations, and I am patient for people to have opportunities to do right. I had to contact the Better Business Bureau to get Landmark to take me seriously enough to do the job correctly this time.

I notified Landmark about the issue in my bathroom in August of 2023 after they purchased and took over my property and raised my rent $300 in one go. (I didnt have much leverage to fight it because I was without a lease as my previous landlord didnt resign my lease before leaving, and Landmark wanted me to agree to the $300 to begin a lease and I chose to eat the cost due to lack of funding to unexpectedly move out at the time.)

They wanted me to agree to raise my rent $50 in April of this year, and I reminded them of my bathroom. They are just now getting a plan of action for a solution to get it done right this time, and it is June of 2024, nearly a year after I originally notified them.

After I continued to follow up, in May of 2024, they offered us to move into a neighboring apartment that has visible mold growing and water damage, as seen in the photos below. It also smelled musty or of stale something like smoke, Im not sure as I was unable to identify it myself. The window lock was broken, the electrical outlets were all pulled away from the wall and faceplates broken, the tub was stained pink, the bathroom cabinet was water damaged to the point of the cabinet wall separating from its self and showing the actual wall between the crack, as visible in a photo below. There was spiders and cobwebs in the corners at the level of the floor. When I complained, Landmark assured me that they had checked in with the cleaners over email. It was dirty. I informed them, and they were slow to respond.

Eventually Landmark offered us another neighboring apartment whose bathroom is directly against ours. We also happen to know the neighbor who lived there before had her ceiling fall through from sewage in her bathroom. The ceiling falling through happened over a year ago, and I dont know if this is where the smell came from, but when we entered the apartment upon offer on June 6, 2024, it visually appeared cleaner, however it smelled like sewage, especially inside underneath the kitchen sink, which happens to be on the opposite side of the wall as the bathroom toilet. Inside the bathroom of the second apartment they offered us, that smelled like sewage inside, the base of the toilet was also shattered, as seen in the photo below. I let Landmark know it smells like sewage and the toilet is a safety hazard. They took time to respond again and finally called this morning, June 12, 2024, to come to an agreement, coincidentally the same day I contacted the Better Business Bureau to request help to resolve this unfortunate issue.

If Landmark just worked with me to come to a solution in a timely and legal manner in the first place, I wouldnt have felt the need to escalate the situation to this point. Im already exhausted and I didnt want to deal with this, but here we are.

As a customer, I highly recommend requesting a walkthrough with Landmark in person, take photos of any and all blemishes and concerns, and send them to landmark with writing that states anything you notice, and dont sign to live anywhere if its not up to standards if you have the option. Luckily I have the ability to advocate for myself. Not everyone is so privileged.

Our community deserves safe, sanitary, and affordable housing! XoXo

(Click on the photos below to read the captions)

owner_response.text:
We're truly sorry for the issues you've experienced. Your frustration is completely understandable. The condition of your new apartment and the previous rent payment mix-up are unacceptable and do not reflect our standards.

Please contact your property management team or email us at info@visitlandmark.com so we can continue to work on resolving these issues.  Our goal and aim are to ensure you have a safe and comfortable living space.

Thank you for your feedback. We hope to make things right and regain your trust.

google_reviews.author: Kristy Heutink
google_reviews.review: The absolute worst property management company I have ever dealt with. Absolutely terrible. They didn't send anybody out to fix a refrigerator for over 6 months. The appliances consistently break. They consider everything damage versus normal wear and tear. They are notorious for changing up the rules without any notice. I definitely would not recommend this company. I have rented through several management companies and have never had the problems I have now

google_reviews.author: Kate Brubaker
google_reviews.review: Im still using Landmark to apartment hunt, but the experience so far has been great. Very informative. I appreciate Deanna and know that Ill feel the same way toward who ever shows me the next place!

google_reviews.author: Jennifer Perry
google_reviews.review: Landmark is by far one of the best reality places! The are understanding, very helpful, and communicate with you quickly, along with following up and making sure maintenance request get completed in a timely fashion! They have been awesome since I completed my application, their process was quick, move in date and having the unit ready for move in!! I would so far 100% recommend Landmark to any future applicants looking for a place and avoiding anywhere else and to only apply with them.. I applied to several other property management companies and this one was far better and quick approval and process!

google_reviews.author: David J Choe
google_reviews.review: Very positive experience being a tenant for Landmark Real Estate. They are good at following through with maintenance and they communicate important updates. They make payment easy and are very kind and understanding. I especially appreciate Lolly, who is very professional and good at her job. Thank you all for the experience.

google_reviews.author: Patricia Zazueta
google_reviews.review:
Landmark Real Estate has a friendly staff and great customer service. They are also quick in responding and coordinating any maintenance requests when necessary.

Since living in Washington, I have rented from Landmark and another property management company; and due to their customer service skills, I prefer Landmark Real Estate.

google_reviews.author: Natalie Grote
google_reviews.review: My property manager, Haelley, has made my time as a tenant of a Landmark property so supported! She is able to answer any questions about upcoming inspections, provide assistance when needed, and helps keep our building up to the standards it deserves. I feel that she not only cares about me as a tenant, but as an individual.

google_reviews.author: Kasie Wagner
google_reviews.review: Ive been renting from Landmark Real Estate Management for the last year and its the best rental experience to date. They are consistent, quick to respond to any concerns, and engaged with the tenants. Should I decide to rent again, I intend to seek their services. They are the most professional real estate management company in this area, by far!!

google_reviews.author: Angie Melton
google_reviews.review: Katherine was super helpful and gave me peace of mind. Knowledgeable on RCW laws and advocates for renters! She guided me in the next steps of getting my deposit back and provided me with my lost lease and everything else I will need! I appreciated her efforts, if I ever need to rent again I would reach out to her!

google_reviews.author: Chris Cook
google_reviews.review:
Landmark gets some points for being pretty much the only apartments that don't require you to make 3 times the rent amount in income (which is unreasonable for many of us), as long as you have the savings to pay the first six months upfront.  But the rest of the points were gone once they used us to pay for improvements as we left.

When we entered the place, it had not been maintained properly.  Nails stuck up from the median between the kitchen and living room.  Rust-prone nails used in the bathroom.  Blinds that didn't reach all the down so our neighbors could see me sleeping.  For f***'s sake, the fridge was just a little bit in the oven's way, so you had to open the fridge door to open the oven door!  My engineer brother kept pointing out various other improper repairs he noticed.  But we hammered down the nail, taped under the blinds, shifted over the oven, and made ourselves a home, burdened only by rowdy neighbors (courtesy of the nearby college I'd bet) and often insufficient parking.  It was the cheapest 2-bedroom apartment around, and it showed, but it wasn't terrible, and we lived there for a few years.

Then it was time for us to move, as they decided the whole complex would not have their leases renewed, and we had to move.  They gave us 8 months forewarning, ahead of the contractually agreed notice, which I do appreciate.  We gave the place a quick once-over cleaning and left, as other life events got in the way and we couldn't give it a proper cleaning.  Ah well, the $1000 deposit was for this kind of thing.  Then we get a notice that it's all used up plus we need to pay another $600.  Why?

Claims that the blinds were damaged (not that I could see any from their inspection pictures), water damage from one of the reported leaks prior, "missing" bulb covers.  You see, I didn't know about the importance of taking pictures/video of everything when moving in and out, so I couldn't prove that not all the lights tucked under the cover were good when we arrived, etc.  Of course, judging by us paying for the damage from their poor plumbing, I guess they'd make sure we still paid out the nose even if we HAD proper documentation.  They had a committee for reviewing security deposit cases, but a couple days later we got a message of basically "We investigated ourselves and found ourselves faultless", you know how it goes.  I expected most of that deposit to be gone, as I left the bathtub filthy, but I didn't expect to be charged so much for "we forgot how sloppy we kept this place when we handed it to you", and my contentions fell on deaf ears that wanted to use me as much as they thought they could get away with to make the place better than they left it.

So if you must take Landmark, go for it.  Your stay will be tolerable, and the courteous management will keep in touch with you about recent issues/repairs.  But take a picture/video of absolutely everything, including empty uninteresting surfaces.  Because they will make you prove that the hallway DIDN'T have door stoppers when you arrived.  Also, while not uncommon these days, they still lose points with me for doing the predatory "you must renew leases 6 months ahead of time or lose it" that ensures you can't shop around without risk of being without a home altogether.  Brace for the pain that only true slumlords can deliver.

Oh, and if you can't afford parking permits right now, just park anyway.  It takes a few months of overfull lots before they consider maybe enforcing parking.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, Chris. We appreciate your feedback and understand your concerns regarding the maintenance of your apartment and the handling of your security deposit. At Landmark, we strive to provide our tenants with a comfortable living experience, and we take your comments seriously.

We are currently reviewing your case to understand better how we can improve our processes and ensure clear communication moving forward. We value your input and hope to address these issues effectively.

Please feel free to reach out to our management team directly if you would like to discuss this matter further.

google_reviews.author: Mariana Mojica
google_reviews.review: My experience with Landmark has been fantastic.  Cami the manager and her team had done their best to ensure that I could have a smooth move. I feel very happy in my new place. Manager is very attentive and does the best she can to make sure her tenants are happy and comfortable in their new place. Thank you Cami.

google_reviews.author: Kaylan Summey
google_reviews.review: We had a misunderstanding of where to meet/pick up the key, Landmark called the realtor to let them know we might be behind and the realtor (Deanne) was very understanding. Deanne was extremely helpful in giving us information about the property as well as general renting tips (were new to renting). They also provided a very helpful packet that described the renting process along with any other information we would need.

google_reviews.author: Maria Morris
google_reviews.review: Efficient, professional, and caring. Appreciated the help with my lock out. I know that we pay good money, but its money well spent when you have such a wonderful team like we have. Would recommend the company and the apartments to anyone. My experience has been A+.

google_reviews.author: Jadey
google_reviews.review: Landmark has been extremely helpful and amazing to work with. I've rented from Landmark since 2011 and have been so grateful for their support, prompt responses and excellent service over the years. One of the best property management companies I've ever rented from. I honestly don't understand the negative reviews. They never leave you hanging and resolve maintenance requests promptly.

owner_response.text: Hi Jadey, Thank you for the 5 star review!

google_reviews.author: Shanell Haight
google_reviews.review: A+ From beginning to getting my key, Landmark has been helpful and consistent.  I would recommend this company to anyone.  Im not the type that would use a management company because I always hear negative things, but Landmark has been very kind and went the extra mile to help me out.

google_reviews.author: Liv Gray. C
google_reviews.review: I have had a wonderful experience with the tour and application process, they are fast, communicative, and helpful. Thank you! A special thank u to our team Cami, Yanna, Tiffany, and Paula they did such a great job helping us get the perfect home!!

google_reviews.author: Janet Henderson
google_reviews.review: Landmark and Katherine Roberts have been by my side since day one of my decision to put my home in the renter pool. Katherine has been available for every need and question, cheerfully offering immediate response and taking the anxiety out of the whole process. I highly recommend Landmark, and particularly Katherine, for anyone needing to generate rental income. -- Janet H.

google_reviews.author: Tom Butler
google_reviews.review: Carmela Cruz is amazing!  Her responsiveness and attention to detail is fantastic.  It's nice to have someone organized and will do whatever it takes to make a customer happy!

google_reviews.author: Sue Hutchings
google_reviews.review:
My special needs son is 31 and ready to live in his own apartment.  We found the perfect spot, not far from me.  We had a few hoops to jump through, in order to make this happen.  None of this would have been possible without the help from Cami and Yanna.  They went above and beyond for us and we are so grateful.  More people like these two, who really care, will make this crazy world we live in, a better place.  Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Sue and Ben

google_reviews.author: Savannah Smith
google_reviews.review:
Weve been renting through landmark since we moved to Bellingham roughly 3 years ago. What started out as a few rough experiences with the homes we were in has turned to a far more positive experience under the current property manager we have and home we are in. Our property manager is efficient and caring. We are very happy.
After seeing other reviews note names l would like to specifically thank Cami, Yanna and Ocean for contributing to our satisfaction.
Cami is absolutely fantastic and any property managed by her l would rent from.

google_reviews.author: Lori Wickham
google_reviews.review: Landmark has gone above and beyond in my application process to help me maintain affordable housing working alongside me with local Community Partners to ensure that I now have a place to call my home! Shout out to Jill & Brittany in assistance. Truly a blessing. Thank you

google_reviews.author: Ryan Okabayashi
google_reviews.review:
My experience with Landmark was very mixed. Signed a year-long lease with two roommates, lived in a house from September 2023 through September 2024. If I was able to write a review for just one person (Lolly, our property manager) it would definitely be 5 stars; she was excellent at communicating, great to talk to, and adept at solving our problems. And we had a LOT of problems.

Landmark pays a separate company to clean their properties in between a change of tenants. Whoever they hire just didnt do half the job. Our downstairs bathroom had dust and debris all over the floor and in the tub, there was food waste and literal garbage in the kitchen cabinets (so we got to move in and immediately deal with ants ), the upstairs floors were incredibly dirty, both bathroom doors had weird marks on them, and they left one of the burners of the stove on! Luckily, we held onto the move-in sheet and listed everything we found. Landmark eventually compensated us for the cleaning WE had to do, which was greatly appreciated.

We also had some issues with bills. During the original application process, one of my roommates submit paystubs from two different jobs to indicate she made enough money to qualify for the rent payments. Whoever ran our applications kept insisting that she didnt qualify and had to get someone to co-sign. It got to the point where my roommate had to send an email where she did the (elementary-school level) math for them. After that, we didnt get a response for over a week, and I had to call landmark just to get an update on whether we got the spot or if we had to keep looking for somewhere else to live. Whoever I spoke with on the phone informed me that we got the spot, and told me the person who had been sending those emails would be calling my roommate to apologize for the inconvenience and lack of communication. For that, I would love to be able to give Landmark props for fixing their problems, but when my roommate received the apology call she was met with some serious attitude and was yelled at for not submitting everything correctly the first time. It was clear this person was only calling because she got in trouble for being bad at her job, and had her feelings hurt when someone called her out. We also had an issue where Landmark took rent payment from this roommate over a week after they said they would, and this discrepancy in expected payment dates caused her to have an overdrafted account. Landmark then charged her $300 for insufficient funds. Now, this very well may have been a genuine mistake, something that just happens sometimes. But me and the third roommate never had this issue with our rent payments, and I find it funny that the only person this happened to was the one who called out a worker at Landmark for not being able to do basic math 

Now, Landmark overall doesnt feel as slum lordy as other property management companies in Bellingham. I know people who had their security deposit outright stolen from them by Utopia (formerly Chuckanut Properties). Again, Lolly was fantastic; she responded promptly, gave the impression that she really cared about us as human beings, and helped us deal with things that werent entirely Landmarks fault (e.g. she contacted City of Bham water for us after they shut off our water because the prior tenants hadnt paid their final water bill). If everyone at Landmark had showed her energy and gone the extra mile like she did, I could easily see myself giving a perfect review. But I just cant do that when they gave us shit before moving in, left a burner of the stove on, left garbage in the kitchen, and then had the audacity to charge us for leaving a couple thumbtack holes in one of the bedrooms.

In summary, Landmark has at least one rockstar employee, and at least a couple more who do their job poorly. The company overall deserves two stars out of five. And, despite this, they might genuinely be the best option for large property-management companies in Bellingham   if you decide to rent through them, hope you get Lolly

google_reviews.author: Nephelle 78
google_reviews.review: I am moving from out of state, which is always added stress. Erika and Ocean at Landmark went above and beyond in helping me navigate the extra steps in my move, were incredibly kind and responsive to all my questions, and my application went through very quickly and without any issues! A very deserved 5 star review, and I recommend anyone who is seeking a rental to apply with Landmark. Thank you for everything!

google_reviews.author: Terrell Harrington
google_reviews.review:
If you have the misfortune of doing business with these people, know that they are here 1st to help you with your rental, and 2nd, to con you out of your deposit.

How would I know that? Because I had to serve them a court summons before they would back down from trying to scam me. Again, if you have to work with these people, absolutely make sure that you 1) take pictures and report any damages upon moving in AND, most importantly, 2) take pictures and video when you move out. Good luck, tenants.

1 star for giving me a place to live
-4 stars for being liars

google_reviews.author: Alex V
google_reviews.review:
Marianna, my property manager, did an excellent job in resolving an issue at the property. She made my issue her top priority and resolved it quickly and with the utmost professionalism. Communication was constant, I could not have asked for better help.

Thank you!

google_reviews.author: Mara Louter
google_reviews.review: When I moved in to my new place, my laundry machine was a mess. After talking with my property manager, Marianna, about the issue, she advocated for me and is getting me a new washing machine. She is a real, personable human and I feel taken care of. Thank you, Marianna!!

google_reviews.author: Kari Miller
google_reviews.review:
Landmark has been top notch through the whole process of renting a place. I have a health condition that reacts to mold from water damaged buildings. After doing a test on place that I couldnt live in they refunded my deposit without question and helped me find a new one. They are a bit slow to respond when emailing or calling but I do eventually get an answer when needing it. I highly recommend this company.

Also, Ocean at the front desk is amazing! She is kind, helpful and patient. She is a big asset to this company/.

google_reviews.author: Stan Grossbard
google_reviews.review: Terrific experience renting an apartment in maritime heritage apts thru landmark.  The process, including getting approval for our two ESA dogs, was fast, smooth and professional.

google_reviews.author: Nate Merklinghaus
google_reviews.review: I work for a commercial contractor and we work with Landmark on many of their properties. They are very responsive and dedicated to making their facilities a great place to work/live. Landmarks fights to be proactive in catching issues before they turn into system failures and trusts their contractors to help them accomplish these goals.

google_reviews.author: Victoria Levine
google_reviews.review: Cami, Ocean and Paula were wonderful to work with and made moving to our new home a breeze. Thanks so much to this great team for making the process seamless for us.

google_reviews.author: Emik Official
google_reviews.review: I had a really great experience working with landmark! Marianna and Angi always done a great job at communicating and making everything go smoothly!!

google_reviews.author: Elisabeth Cross
google_reviews.review: Quick and compassionate communication! Maintenance is handled promptly and expectations are communicated honestly. Breath of fresh air in the Bellingham area! Have been with landmark for years.

google_reviews.author: Kaila Johnson
google_reviews.review: Amazing experience working with Landmark, more specifically Ocean, she went above and beyond to help us get our application filed and docs submitted.

google_reviews.author: Ryan Pedersen
google_reviews.review: Cami is super nice, caring to your concerns, and quick to find a solution. Would rent from her again for sure!

google_reviews.author: Kyle DelCampo
google_reviews.review: Deanna was amazing! Very personable and knowledgeable of the unit she showed us. Very pleasant experience!

google_reviews.author: Paula Dunn-Dawson
google_reviews.review: Lolly has been amazing at communicating with me and providing timely information. I would recommend her to anyone to work with!

google_reviews.author: melinda pearson
google_reviews.review:
UPDATE 9/24: So far, so good. Our contact, Sade, was amazing - went above and beyond to help us with a package that arrived before our lease start date! There were some kind of unexpected charges, or ways that perhaps we misunderstood things (e.g., the utilities charge is not $40 for the unit but $40 per person), but all-in-all, pre-move-in has been smooth. More later!

So far, the application process with Landmark has been smooth! The various staff members I've spoken with have been friendly and helpful, and the process was made extremely clear. Their application fee is $65, compared to $50 for most other property managers in Bellingham, but so far that is our only criticism. Move-in is in September so will update with any new feedback then, but they have so far proven trustworthy, communicative and friendly. And their portal is really helpful also!

google_reviews.author: Bryan Couture
google_reviews.review: Viewing the apartment alone using a code to get in was pretty cool.  If you want a place that Landmark is renting, be sure to get you holding fee in right away.  Use the night drop!

owner_response.text:
Good morning, I am sorry if you are frustrated by your experience. Is there anything I can do to help you find something else?
Thank you
Tia Herring/Lead Showing Agent

google_reviews.author: Michelle K
google_reviews.review: Have had an excellent experience with all staff during the application and search process alone. Wanda, Leslie, Paula, and Frank are an amazing group I've been able to deal with and they have all made the process smooth, clear, and enjoyable. We aren't even tenants yet and I have felt very respected and welcomed by the friendly people. Everyone at the office was marvelous and making a great environment for solving any problems and answering all questions.

google_reviews.author: DAKO.
google_reviews.review: Wanda's willingness to go the extra mile truly set her apart. google_reviews.author: Daniel Sabala

Cami and Yanna consistently go above and beyond, staying on top of every detail to ensure everything runs smoothly. google_reviews.author: Evan Steinhilb
google_reviews.review: My experience with Ocean has been amazing! Very proactive and customer focused, thanks Ocean!

google_reviews.author: Kimberly Zavala
google_reviews.review: Always a pleasure working with Landmark! Their agents are caring individuals who go above and beyond for their tenants/prospective tenants! Absolutely recommend!

google_reviews.author: Bianca Benfanti
google_reviews.review: Had a recent experience with the discovery of mold in our rental property and my husband and I really appreciated how much Cami, our property manager, handled the whole thing! Cami was super attentive and considerate, keeping in mind that I was 38 weeks pregnant and could be due any day. She was on top of making sure we were appropriately compensated and settled down.

google_reviews.author: Ryder Church
google_reviews.review: Speaking with the team at Landmark was immensely relieving after speaking/emailing many other companies (PTLA) that are far less understanding or accommodating.
