I asked if she could send me an email with the new management company information and contacts and she straight up told me "NO" she would not do that.  She said if I want any information I would need to wait until her manager came in or leave a voicemail.  Really?  You transferred my contract with you and then refuse to send me an email to give me the information?   This is only the recent frustration.  This apartment had broken lights, broken toilet and bug infestation when my daughter moved in.  They did manage to fix the light, but the bugs are so disgusting my daughter will often times will come to my house to spend the night even though we have to continue to pay rent.   DO NOT RENT FROM THEM

yelp_reviews.author: Jordan B.
yelp_reviews.review: I am warning you, DO NOT RENT FROM THESE PEOPLE. My boyfriend and I live in the Southgate apartments which are managed by landmark. We rent a 2 bedroom apartment and were promised 2 parking spaces, for 6 months we parked in our assigned spots and had no problems. In January more people starting moving in, and there for the parking lot got more full (the parking lot doesnt have enough spaces for tenant capacity) and we were told that they  finally had parking permits and to come pick them up. I went to get our 2 passes and they had the nerve to tell me that they "reworked some things" and now one bedroom and 2 bedroom apartments only get 1 spot and the 3 bedrooms get 2 parking spots. DOES THAT MAKE SENSE TO ANYONE?! There is no guest parking, no street parking, and literally no where else to park our other car. I mention that to them and the property manager tells me "some people dont even have a spot, you should be thankful you have 1" well b**tch our lease says exactly "the tenant in allowed to have 2 cars on the premises" so not only did they break there lease, but our other car has to be parked almost a half a mile away!! I have never dealt with more inconsiderate people and not to mention they never call back when you call them and one time I waited over a month for maintenance to finally come fix things for me, and I had to put in THREE maintenance request before they got around to doing anything. Im gonna say it one more time DO NOT RENT FROM THESE PEOPLE OR YOU WILL REGRET IT

owner_response.text:
Hi Jordan, this is Candace, the property manager of Southgate apartments, I wanted to thank you for your feedback and I am deeply sorry for the inconvenience around the parking at Southgate.
 
As you know, parking is limited at Southgate, after tenant complaints and confusion over who parks where, we are switching to assigned parking with permits.  When we did an audit of our current parking, we discovered that tenants in 1 and 2 bedroom units had been assigned several parking spots that were assigned to vacant 3 bedroom units. Therefore, we are reshuffling things to ensure that all our tenants have access to at least one parking space.
 
Prior to making this change official, we made efforts to inform our current tenants about the change with a notice in October of the initial audit and again in December of the final change. Both notices contained information on the reduction of parking for 1 & 2 bedrooms and the alternative location to park on Byron Street.
 
As for maintenance, we are constantly working to ensure tenants would continue receiving timely maintenance services.
 
We are working hard at Southgate to make it an enjoyable place to live. Change is not always an easy thing to endue however sometimes it is necessary to improve situations.
 
We hope that you understand that these changes will improve customer service to our valued tenants.
 
-Candace

yelp_reviews.author: D R.
yelp_reviews.review: Stay away from this company. My daughter had to put a deposit down sight unseen for an apartment yet the actual apartment was more dated & in need of serious tlc. It was to have been ready days before we moved in & they were still working on it when we started moving it. The place was half painted & filthy. The carpet was so disgusting, even after supposedly being cleaned that I refused to allow my daughter to be responsible for cleaning carpets that needed to be replaced & could never just be cleaned. The carpet looked 20 years old. Ridiculous. So I got into it w/ the general manager & threatened legal action. My daughter was starting school the following week & we had signed ( I cosigned) months prior so finding another place on such short notice was not realistic. So she gave me a waiver, in writing, that she would not be charged for the carpet cleaning. Make no mistake, the place was not clean, non-working fan,lights, and a heat register as well as the toilet not flushing. I documented everything, first on the move in list then in an email to the general manager  & of course dozens of pictures. The maintenance man fixed the heater, the fan & the toilet after several weeks but nothing else got done. We did the cleaning ourselves. My daughter was nicely ensconced into school & couldn't be bothered chasing him down & asked me just to give up. So disgraceful. The complex was not maintained & it's a skating rink when it snows. Lawsuit waiting to happen. And they let just anyone rent from them from potheads to heavy partiers. 8 months in they want her to sign another contract for another year lease & when she didn't commit, they started showing her unit w/ often times less that 24 hours notice twice a week for about a month straight before I gave them notice that they were affecting my daughters enjoyment & per WA State law, they were abusing their right to enter. In every situation w/ these people, you will need to send any communication certified. Fast forward, they renter her place out, upon moving out, we took many pictures. The place was much cleaner when she moved out than in. Along w/ the keys, I included her forwarding address along w/ the reminder that she had a waive on the carpet cleaning. After several calls,, she finally got a walk thru. The employee acknowledged that the unit was cleaner than on move in, that they had recieved her forwarding address as well as her permanent (my) home address & that they were fully aware of the carpet cleaning waiver. Two weeks later, no deposit. After almost 3 weeks, she gets the deposit- the apt # was not on the envelop-you have got to wonder if it was on purpose- & it was mailed out the very last day it legally could be. Alas, they charged her for the carpet cleaning AND the lightbulb that they NEVER replaced & were told about 3 times claiming there wasn't a maintence request put in for it-insane! So of course I'm furious, I leave them a very heated message about how they failed to address the envelope containing her "partial" deposit, that the lightbulb WAS reported & that we verified ALL was aware of the carpet cleaning waiver. My daughter gets a condescending "I don't give a s$@t" response from a Casey claiming the lightbulb was on us & they needed a copy of the waiver as well as the request in writing. I was not amused. I dropped off a copy of all & sent a very pointed email to this Casey- no response, of course. It will be a week tomorrow & if she doen't have the balance of her deposit by Monday, I'm filing is small claims. Because what they're doing is considered "bad faith" in legal terns, not only will I go after the balance ( I really think they didn't think that I still have my copy of the waiver, but hell, they could just be really flipping incompetent) but all of my costs doing business w/ these jokers thus far w/ my certified mailings as well as court costs & I'm going to ask the judge to use their discretion & fine them the full extent of the law. I'm very aware of their reputation as there is a long line of previous Landmark Realty (they also used to call themselved PMP- more terrible reviews using that name as well) tenants who have sought out the help of the local Tenant Clinic so if any of you out there are wanting to join in a  class action type of small claims case, feel free to email me @ drobnson14@aol.com because in 5 days, I'll be filing. I have dealt w/ my fair share of slumlords in my life, but this group takes the prize.

yelp_reviews.author: Jeremy A.
yelp_reviews.review: I scheduled a walk through when I moved from one of their apartments after thoroughly cleaning the place. I waited 30 minutes and she never showed, forcing me to drive to the office to turn in the keys. Three weeks later I received $1300 dollars in fees for various false claims. The inspection report they filled out by their employees, without my presence, was completely false. I repainted over half the apartment because I lived there 8 years and they were faded and ugly, then they stated the walls were dirty. If you rent from them take pictures,v save them and document everything. This company are crooks in the business of screwing their tenants. Cover cover your ass or you'll be posting on of these as well. And forget about maintenance requests, that's not in their job description and they conveniently don't keep documentation that doesn't financially benefit them, that's the tenants job. Would love to be a part of a class action lawsuit against them.

summary.text:
Good

Landmark Real Estate Management has received numerous positive reviews highlighting their customer service and responsiveness. Many users report a smooth application process, noting that the staff is friendly and helpful. For instance, one tenant described how the team efficiently guided them through the rental application and made the entire moving process stress-free, allowing for great communication throughout. Additionally, those who worked with specific property managers often emphasized their attentiveness and timely responses to maintenance requests, creating a positive living experience.

Another user appreciated the overall management of the properties, citing a clean and well-maintained environment. Highlighting individual staff members, several reviews indicated specific managers who went above and beyond to address tenant needs, showing dedication and professionalism. One tenant shared a particularly heartwarming experience about a property manager who took the time to ensure their family felt comfortable and supported during the transition into a new home. Such testimonies reflect the commendable efforts of Landmark’s team in fostering positive tenant relationships.

Great

There are standout instances where tenants have expressed great satisfaction with Landmark's services. Many reviews rave about how the management team promptly addresses maintenance issues, sometimes even tackling them within hours of being reported. One user shared their experience of having a broken appliance fixed quickly and without hassle, expressing appreciation for how quickly maintenance personnel was dispatched. Such positivity points to a generally reliable service that meets tenant needs promptly.

Another common theme in the reviews is the positive attitude of the staff. Numerous users have noted how agents go the extra mile, providing resources and support for first-time renters or students new to apartment living. This supportive atmosphere can make a significant difference, especially for those unfamiliar with the rental process. Users have mentioned that this friendliness often leads to a sense of community among tenants, making their experiences with Landmark more enjoyable and reassuring.

Bad

While Landmark has many positive reviews, some tenants have reported issues with communication and responsiveness. A common complaint involves long wait times for responses to maintenance requests, which can lead to tenant frustration. One user mentioned a persistent delay in addressing simple repairs that barely impacted their living, but highlighted the lack of urgency in the management's approach to such requests. This sentiment of being overlooked surfaced in several reviews, showcasing an inconsistency in service level among the team.

Additionally, some users have noted challenges in their dealings with the office staff. Instances of poor communication or miscommunication were frequently mentioned, where tenants had to follow-up numerous times for what should have been straightforward requests. A user described that despite attempts to clarify issues through emails or calls, they often felt brushed aside, highlighting the need for improved communication within the company. Though these experiences may not represent the majority, they are significant enough to be noted as areas for improvement.

Ugly

Unfortunately, numerous reviews detail concerning experiences that highlight serious issues with Landmark's customer service and professionalism. Multiple users reported significant delays and lack of follow-through regarding maintenance requests, where urgent issues remained unresolved for weeks. A particular review detailed a prolonged struggle with mold problems that persisted despite repeated reports to management, causing distress to the residents. Such accounts raise alarms about maintenance efficacy and tenant safety.

Furthermore, there were alarming claims regarding security deposit handling once tenants moved out. Several tenants reported receiving minimal refunds or being charged for alleged damages that they disputed, asserting that the properties were left in excellent condition. Complaints about receiving cumulative charges for normal wear and tear were prevalent, with some residents expressing frustration over the difficulty in reclaiming these deposits. This lack of accountability has created a troubling perception of Landmark, with some users even threatening legal action to recover their money. Such patterns of behavior suggest a troubling trend that potential tenants should be wary of before committing to a lease.
